title: Technical SEO - MozMoz logoMenu openMenu closeSearchMoz logo
description: Your all-in-one suite of SEO essentials.
content: E By: Evan Hall May 12, 2020 Use the Blank Sheet of Paper Test to Optimize for Natural Language Processing Technical SEO | Search Engines | Advanced SEO The Blank Sheet of Paper Test determines if what you’ve written has meaning to someone who has never encountered your brand or content before. But what if we’re performing the BSoPT on a machine instead of a person? Does our thought experiment still apply? Read this post By: Michael Wiegand April 20, 2020 Why Site Speed Still Matters (Revisited) Technical SEO | Advanced SEO Portent's latest site speed study refresh looked at 10 websites spanning a number of industries and 26,000 different landing pages, ranging in performance from extremely slow pages to extremely fast. The results show that every second you can shave off your page load speed has intense conversion rate benefits that defy differences in verticals or selling approaches. Read this post By: Cyrus Shepard April 15, 2020 Opting Out of Google Featured Snippets Led to 12% Traffic Loss [SEO Experiment] Advanced SEO | Search Engines | Technical SEO Working with the team at SearchPilot, we devised an A/B split test experiment to remove Moz Blog posts from Google featured snippets, and measure the impact on traffic. Read this post By: Cyrus Shepard February 25, 2020 Are H1 Tags Necessary for Ranking? [SEO Experiment] SEO Basics | Technical SEO In earlier days of search marketing, SEOs often heard the same two best practices repeated so many times it became implanted in our brains: Wrap the title of your page in H1 tags and use only one H1 tag per page. Despite assertions from one of Google's most trusted authorities that sites "can do perfectly fine with no H1 tags or with five H1 tags", many SEOs didn't believe it. So of course, we decided to test it scientifically. Read this post By: Britney Muller February 14, 2020 How to Get Your Web Developer on Board with SEO [Bonus PDF] Advanced SEO | Technical SEO | Whiteboard Friday Your web devs are your other half — the key to getting your SEO work done well and quickly. In this Whiteboard Friday, learn 6 essential ways to get your web dev on board with SEO. Plus, download the new Web Developer's SEO Cheat Sheet free! Read this post By: Britney Muller January 10, 2020 Intro to Python Technical SEO | Whiteboard Friday Python is a programming language that can help you uncover incredible SEO insights and save you time by automating time-consuming tasks. But for those who haven't explored this side of search, it can be intimidating. Britney Muller and a true python expert offer an intro into a helpful tool that's worth your time to learn. Read this post By: Tom Anthony December 30, 2019 Better Site Speed: 4 Outside-the-Box Ideas Technical SEO | Advanced SEO Site speed is incredibly important, but we often rely on the same old methods for improvement. Tom Anthony covers some unusual and surprising tricks to improving site speed that you may not have considered. Read this post By: Jeff Baker November 5, 2019 This Is What Happens When You Accidentally De-Index Your Site from Google SEO Analytics | Technical SEO | Advanced SEO Imagine it: the worst has happened, and a code deploy wipes your site from Google's index. What do you do? Take notes on this real-life hard lesson when their search presence was cut by 1/3 due to exactly that. Read this post By: Britney Muller October 25, 2019 Machine Learning 101 Technical SEO | Whiteboard Friday | AI and SEO Machine learning is only growing in importance for anyone working in the digital world, but it can often feel like an inaccessible subject. It doesn't have to be — and you don't have to miss out on the competitive edge it can give you when it comes to SEO task automation. Read this post By: Catalin Rosu October 8, 2019 A Breakdown of HTML Usage Across ~8 Million Pages (& What It Means for Modern SEO) Technical SEO How are ~8 million pages across the web using HTML, and what implications does it have for modern SEO? Dive into the details of this in-depth study analyzing how prevalent meta tags, structured data, social markup, and more are in HTML for millions of index pages. Read this post By: Cyrus Shepard September 10, 2019 How Google's Rel = Nofollow, Sponsored, & UGC Links Impact SEO On-page SEO | Technical SEO | SEO Basics Google shook up the SEO world by announcing big changes to how publishers should mark nofollow links. The changes — while beneficial to help Google understand the web — nonetheless caused confusion and raised a number of questions. We've got the answers to many of your questions here. Read this post By: Kameron Jenkins August 23, 2019 Goodbye, Generic SEO Audit – Say Hello to Customization & Prioritization Technical SEO | Whiteboard Friday | Advanced SEO Though an SEO audit is essentially a checklist, it's important to both customize your approach and prioritize your fixes to be efficient and effective with your time and effort. In today's Whiteboard Friday, Kameron Jenkins shares a better way of improving your site. Read this post By: Lily Ray August 21, 2019 FAQ, HowTo, and Q&A: Using New Schema Types to Create Interactive Rich Results Advanced SEO | Technical SEO | SEO Tools Avoid misusing Schema, or it’s possible Google might take away these fantastic opportunities to enhance our organic listings in the future. Read this post By: Paul Shapiro August 2, 2019 Programming for SEOs Technical SEO | Whiteboard Friday In today's Whiteboard Friday, master technical SEO Paul Shapiro shares why it's so important for SEOs and marketers to take the programming plunge, explains key concepts, and helps you determine the best course of action for you to get started when it comes to leveling up your technical prowess. Read this post
